The Major General put out his arms and caught

1916.text: 'That's right, Sergeant Jameson, lean on me.

1919.text:
It's what generals are here for,' he said, and then 
placed the medal in the man's one remaining hand.

1930.text:
After lunch the men piled back into the gym
for the tug-of-war.

1934.text:
They'd painted their faces blue and white
and scrounged tartan from the company lines.

1940.text:
The 'Rabbits' of C Company went out first,
followed by Right Flank.

1943.text:
The bruisers from the Motor Transport Platoon
then put Headquarter Company into the final

1951.text: Left Flank took their positions on the rope.

1953.text:
At the front stood their commander Major Rupert
Kitching and Guardsman Maciu Kabunicaucau

1961.text:
'Last time I saw that Guardsman I was giving
him first aid in Afghanistan and half his

1965.text:
face was shot off,' said a startled Captain
Rowe.

1968.text: 'Look at that,' said the Pipe Major.

1971.text:
'Someone's going to win as the clock strikes
16:42!' - the year the Scots Guards were founded.

1976.text:
'Aye, shame the clock's an hour fast,' said
the Sergeant Major.

1980.text:
Left Flank crowded round their team, shouting
'Easy! Easy! Easy!' as their boys pulled

1986.text: on the rope, and they won.

1989.text:
The Commanding Officer called his men into
a three-sided square rounded and handed out

1993.text: cups to the best three teams.

1996.text:
'Well, I think it's been a fantastic day,'
he said, and walked over to a wheelchair.

2005.text:
'Guardsman Watson, do you think it's been
a fantastic day?'

2009.text:
'But I reckon we should have a 10 o'clock start 
in the morning.' The whole battalion cheered.

2016.text:
The next morning I drove out of the barracks
for the last time, suitably hungover.

2022.text:
I thought of the men left behind and the 10,000
British ambassadors still in Helmand Province,

2026.text:
and of those that would follow them, still looking 
for their war, and of the system that sends them.

2032.text:
[Samuel Taylor] Coleridge's words played over
in my head:

2041.text: And they all dead did lie.

2043.text: And a thousand, thousand slimy things

2046.text: Lived on, and so did I.
